SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

jpo
Class Settings

java.lang.Object
  jpo.Settings
public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines all the settings for the JPO application. In order for it to be valid for all objects it's components are all static as is the Settings object itself when created.

The SettingsDialog is the editor for these settings.

dontEnlargeSmallImages

jarAutostartList

public static java.net.URL jarAutostartList
Object that gets populated by the main Jpo object if it can discover a file called autostartJarPicturelist in the Classpath. This is only supposed to be the case for jar bundled archives of pictures and code. If the file is discovered this URL object is populated. Otherwise it is null. You can test for null on it.

jarRoot

public static java.lang.String jarRoot
the path to the jar file; derived from jarAutostartList

unsavedSettingChanges

public static boolean unsavedSettingChanges
variable that tracks if there are unsaved changes in these settings.

URL of the document type definition in the xml file.

public static javax.swing.JFrame anchorFrame

maxCache

public static int maxCache
The maximum number of pictures to keep in memory

maximumPictureSize

public static int maximumPictureSize
The maximum size a picture is zoomed to. This is to stop the Java engine creating enormous temporaty images which lock the computer up copletely.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

advanceTimerPollingInterval

public static final int advanceTimerPollingInterval
The interval between the timer checking to see if the picture is ready before the main delay loop should be waited. You want to give the user the specified seconds to look at the picture and not subtract from that the time it took the program to load the image.

See Also:

notifies the listeners that the target drop nodes have changed.

removeRecentDropNode

public static void removeRecentDropNode(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode deathNode)
method to remove one of the recent Drop Nodes. It is important to check each time a node is deleted whether it or one of it's descendents is a drop target as this would no longer be a valid target.

clearRecentDropNodes

public static void clearRecentDropNodes()
clears the list of recent drop nodes

memorizeCopyLocation

public static void memorizeCopyLocation(java.lang.String location)
This method memorizes the copy targets so that they can be accessed more quickly next time round.

validateCopyLocations

public static boolean validateCopyLocations()
This method validates that the copy locations are valid directories and if not sets the entry in the copyLocations array to null.

Returns:
Returns true if the array was changed, false if not.

getMostRecentCopyLocation

public static java.io.File getMostRecentCopyLocation()
This method returns the most recently used copy location. If there is no most recent copyLocation then the user's home directory is returned.

Returns:
Returns the most recent copy location directory or the user's home directory

public static void addCopyLocationsChangeListener(CopyLocationsChangeListener listener)
